div.head: OPINION OF HUMBOLDT.
div.p:
The celebrated Baron Humboldt has written a
note to Dr. Franz Schegel, M. D. of AltenberghAltenburgh,
Germany, in “relation to the moving of tables.”—
He writes—

“It is easier to combat a theory than facts im-
perfectly observed. There are diseases of belief
which return periodically, and are as endemical
with the polished as with the lower classes, be-
cause in the former they assume the form of dog-
matism and arrogance peculiar to the superficial.—
I tender you, most honored Doctor, my kindest
thanks for the publication of your very simple
mechanical explanation of the turning of tables
towards the north pole. But you will convert no-
body.

closer.salute:
With the highest esteem, &c.
Alexander Von Humboldt.
